content: Singapore Saving Bonds (SSB) Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 24 Feb 2019This month's SSB tranche (March 2019) - worth it?was looking at the Average return per year to be 2.18% after 10 years, but it seems rather low - should I go ahead to invest in it if I may hold it to maturity?1 answerAnswerBump0

Nicholes Wong, Diploma in Business Management at Nanyang PolytechnicLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 26 Feb 2019Its getting abit lower. Maybe you can put 50% inside first. Then wait for returns to go up before putting more. If your money is just sitting there earning low interest, i think invest some right now would be better. Or you can look at high interest savings account.0 comments0
